trans-unit.source: How to Build Complex Schedules and Advanced Recurrence with Azure Scheduler
trans-unit.target: How to Build Complex Schedules and Advanced Recurrence with Azure Scheduler

trans-unit.source: How to Build Complex Schedules and Advanced Recurrence with Azure Scheduler
trans-unit.target: How to Build Complex Schedules and Advanced Recurrence with Azure Scheduler

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: At the heart of an Azure Scheduler job is the *schedule*.
trans-unit.target: At the heart of an Azure Scheduler job is the *schedule*.

trans-unit.source: The schedule determines when and how the Scheduler executes the job.
trans-unit.target: The schedule determines when and how the Scheduler executes the job.

trans-unit.source: Azure Scheduler allows you to specify different one-time and recurring schedules for a job.
trans-unit.target: Azure Scheduler allows you to specify different one-time and recurring schedules for a job.

trans-unit.source: *One-time* schedules fire once at a specified time – effectively, they are *recurring* schedules that execute only once.
trans-unit.target: *One-time* schedules fire once at a specified time – effectively, they are *recurring* schedules that execute only once.

trans-unit.source: Recurring schedules fire on a predetermined frequency.
trans-unit.target: Recurring schedules fire on a predetermined frequency.

trans-unit.source: With this flexibility, Azure Scheduler lets you support a wide variety of business scenarios:
trans-unit.target: With this flexibility, Azure Scheduler lets you support a wide variety of business scenarios:

trans-unit.source: Periodic data cleanup – e.g., every day, delete all tweets older than 3 months
trans-unit.target: Periodic data cleanup – e.g., every day, delete all tweets older than 3 months

trans-unit.source: Archival – e.g., every month, push invoice history to backup service
trans-unit.target: Archival – e.g., every month, push invoice history to backup service

trans-unit.source: Requests for external data – e.g., every 15 minutes, pull new ski weather report from NOAA
trans-unit.target: Requests for external data – e.g., every 15 minutes, pull new ski weather report from NOAA

trans-unit.source: Image processing – e.g. every weekday, during off-peak hours, use cloud computing to compress images uploaded that day
trans-unit.target: Image processing – e.g. every weekday, during off-peak hours, use cloud computing to compress images uploaded that day

trans-unit.source: In this article, we walk through example jobs that you can create with Azure Scheduler.
trans-unit.target: In this article, we walk through example jobs that you can create with Azure Scheduler.

trans-unit.source: We provide the JSON data that describes each schedule.
trans-unit.target: We provide the JSON data that describes each schedule.

trans-unit.source: If you use the [Scheduler REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn528946.aspx), you can use this same JSON for [creating an Azure Scheduler job](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn528937.aspx).
trans-unit.target: If you use the [Scheduler REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn528946.aspx), you can use this same JSON for [creating an Azure Scheduler job](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn528937.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Supported Scenarios
trans-unit.target: Supported Scenarios

trans-unit.source: The many examples in this topic illustrate the breadth of scenarios that Azure Scheduler supports.
trans-unit.target: The many examples in this topic illustrate the breadth of scenarios that Azure Scheduler supports.

trans-unit.source: Broadly, these examples illustrate how to create schedules for many behavior patterns, including the ones below:
trans-unit.target: Broadly, these examples illustrate how to create schedules for many behavior patterns, including the ones below:

trans-unit.source: Run once at a particular date and time
trans-unit.target: Run once at a particular date and time

trans-unit.source: Run and recur a number of explicit times
trans-unit.target: Run and recur a number of explicit times

trans-unit.source: Run immediately and recur
trans-unit.target: Run immediately and recur

trans-unit.source: Run and recur every *n* minutes, hours, days, weeks, or months, starting at a particular time
trans-unit.target: Run and recur every *n* minutes, hours, days, weeks, or months, starting at a particular time

trans-unit.source: Run and recur at weekly or monthly frequency but only on specific days, specific days of week, or specific days of month
trans-unit.target: Run and recur at weekly or monthly frequency but only on specific days, specific days of week, or specific days of month

trans-unit.source: Run and recur at multiple times in a period – e.g., last Friday and Monday of every month, or at 5:15am and 5:15pm every day
trans-unit.target: Run and recur at multiple times in a period – e.g., last Friday and Monday of every month, or at 5:15am and 5:15pm every day

trans-unit.source: Dates and DateTimes
trans-unit.target: Dates and DateTimes

trans-unit.source: Dates in Azure Scheduler jobs follow the [ISO-8601 specification](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) and include only the date.
trans-unit.target: Dates in Azure Scheduler jobs follow the [ISO-8601 specification](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) and include only the date.

trans-unit.source: Date-Time references in Azure Scheduler jobs follow the [ISO-8601 specification](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) and include both date and time parts.
trans-unit.target: Date-Time references in Azure Scheduler jobs follow the [ISO-8601 specification](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) and include both date and time parts.

trans-unit.source: A Date-Time that does not specify a UTC offset is assumed to be UTC.
trans-unit.target: A Date-Time that does not specify a UTC offset is assumed to be UTC.

trans-unit.source: How To: Use JSON and REST API for Creating Schedules
trans-unit.target: How To: Use JSON and REST API for Creating Schedules

trans-unit.source: To create a simple schedule using the JSON examples in this article and the Azure Scheduler REST API, [first create a cloud service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn528943.aspx), [then create a job collection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn528940.aspx), and [finally create a job](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn528937.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To create a simple schedule using the JSON examples in this article and the Azure Scheduler REST API, [first create a cloud service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn528943.aspx), [then create a job collection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn528940.aspx), and [finally create a job](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn528937.aspx).

trans-unit.source: When you create a job, you can specify scheduling and recurrence using JSON like the one excerpted below:
trans-unit.target: When you create a job, you can specify scheduling and recurrence using JSON like the one excerpted below:

trans-unit.source: Overview: Job Schema Basics
trans-unit.target: Overview: Job Schema Basics

trans-unit.source: The following table provides a high-level overview of the major elements related to recurrence and scheduling in a job:
trans-unit.target: The following table provides a high-level overview of the major elements related to recurrence and scheduling in a job:

trans-unit.source: JSON name
trans-unit.target: JSON name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: startTime
trans-unit.target: startTime

trans-unit.source: _startTime_ is a Date-Time.
trans-unit.target: _startTime_ is a Date-Time.

trans-unit.source: For simple schedules, _startTime_ is the first occurrence and for complex schedules, the job will start no sooner than _startTime_.
trans-unit.target: For simple schedules, _startTime_ is the first occurrence and for complex schedules, the job will start no sooner than _startTime_.

trans-unit.source: recurrence
trans-unit.target: recurrence

trans-unit.source: The _recurrence_ object specifies recurrence rules for the job and the recurrence the job will execute with.
trans-unit.target: The _recurrence_ object specifies recurrence rules for the job and the recurrence the job will execute with.

trans-unit.source: The recurrence object supports the elements _frequency, interval, endTime, count,_ and _schedule_.
trans-unit.target: The recurrence object supports the elements _frequency, interval, endTime, count,_ and _schedule_.

trans-unit.source: If _recurrence_ is defined, _frequency_ is required; the other elements of _recurrence_ are optional.
trans-unit.target: If _recurrence_ is defined, _frequency_ is required; the other elements of _recurrence_ are optional.

trans-unit.source: frequency
trans-unit.target: frequency

trans-unit.source: The _frequency_ string representing the frequency unit at which the job recurs.
trans-unit.target: The _frequency_ string representing the frequency unit at which the job recurs.

trans-unit.source: Supported values are _"minute", "hour", "day", "week",_ or _"month."_
trans-unit.target: Supported values are _"minute", "hour", "day", "week",_ or _"month."_

trans-unit.source: interval
trans-unit.target: interval

trans-unit.source: The _interval_ is a positive integer and denotes the interval for the _frequency_ that determines how often the job will run.
trans-unit.target: The _interval_ is a positive integer and denotes the interval for the _frequency_ that determines how often the job will run.

trans-unit.source: For example, if _interval_ is 3 and _frequency_ is "week", the job recurs every 3 weeks.
trans-unit.target: For example, if _interval_ is 3 and _frequency_ is "week", the job recurs every 3 weeks.

trans-unit.source: Azure Scheduler supports a maximum _interval_ of 18 months for monthly frequency, 78 weeks for weekly frequency, or 548 days for daily frequency.
trans-unit.target: Azure Scheduler supports a maximum _interval_ of 18 months for monthly frequency, 78 weeks for weekly frequency, or 548 days for daily frequency.

trans-unit.source: For hour and minute frequency, the supported range is 1 <= _interval_ <= 1000.
trans-unit.target: For hour and minute frequency, the supported range is 1 <= _interval_ <= 1000.

trans-unit.source: endTime
trans-unit.target: endTime

trans-unit.source: The _endTime_ string specifies the date-time past which the job should not execute.
trans-unit.target: The _endTime_ string specifies the date-time past which the job should not execute.

trans-unit.source: It is not valid to have an _endTime_ in the past.
trans-unit.target: It is not valid to have an _endTime_ in the past.

trans-unit.source: If no _endTime_ or count is specified, the job runs infinitely.
trans-unit.target: If no _endTime_ or count is specified, the job runs infinitely.

trans-unit.source: Both _endTime_ and _count_ cannot be included for the same job.
trans-unit.target: Both _endTime_ and _count_ cannot be included for the same job.

trans-unit.source: count
trans-unit.target: count

trans-unit.source: The _count_ is a positive integer (greater than zero) that specifies the number of times this job should run before completing.
trans-unit.target: The _count_ is a positive integer (greater than zero) that specifies the number of times this job should run before completing.

trans-unit.source: The _count_ represents the number of times the job runs before being determined as completed.
trans-unit.target: The _count_ represents the number of times the job runs before being determined as completed.

trans-unit.source: For example, for a job that is executed daily with _count_ 5 and start date of Monday, the job completes after execution on Friday.
trans-unit.target: For example, for a job that is executed daily with _count_ 5 and start date of Monday, the job completes after execution on Friday.

trans-unit.source: If the start date is in the past, the first execution is calculated from the creation time.
trans-unit.target: If the start date is in the past, the first execution is calculated from the creation time.

trans-unit.source: If no _endTime_ or _count_ is specified, the job runs infinitely.
trans-unit.target: If no _endTime_ or _count_ is specified, the job runs infinitely.

trans-unit.source: Both _endTime_ and _count_ cannot be included for the same job.
trans-unit.target: Both _endTime_ and _count_ cannot be included for the same job.

trans-unit.source: schedule
trans-unit.target: schedule

trans-unit.source: A job with a specified frequency alters its recurrence based on a recurrence schedule.
trans-unit.target: A job with a specified frequency alters its recurrence based on a recurrence schedule.

trans-unit.source: A _schedule_ contains modifications based on minutes, hours, week days, month days, and week number.
trans-unit.target: A _schedule_ contains modifications based on minutes, hours, week days, month days, and week number.

trans-unit.source: Overview: Job Schema Defaults, Limits, and Examples
trans-unit.target: Overview: Job Schema Defaults, Limits, and Examples

trans-unit.target: After this overview, let’s discuss each of these elements in detail.

trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.target: "minute", "hour", "day", "week", "month"

trans-unit.source: Deep Dive: _startTime_
trans-unit.target: Deep Dive: _startTime_

trans-unit.source: The following table captures how _startTime_ controls how a job is run.
trans-unit.target: The following table captures how _startTime_ controls how a job is run.

trans-unit.source: startTime value
trans-unit.target: startTime value

trans-unit.source: No recurrence
trans-unit.target: No recurrence

trans-unit.source: Recurrence.
trans-unit.target: Recurrence.

trans-unit.source: No schedule
trans-unit.target: No schedule

trans-unit.source: Recurrence with schedule
trans-unit.target: Recurrence with schedule

trans-unit.source: No start time
trans-unit.target: No start time

trans-unit.source: Run once immediately
trans-unit.target: Run once immediately

trans-unit.source: Run once immediately.
trans-unit.target: Run once immediately.

trans-unit.source: Run subsequent executions based on calculating from last execution time
trans-unit.target: Run subsequent executions based on calculating from last execution time

trans-unit.source: Run once immediately
trans-unit.target: Run once immediately

trans-unit.source: Run subsequent executions based on recurrence schedule
trans-unit.target: Run subsequent executions based on recurrence schedule

trans-unit.source: Start time in past
trans-unit.target: Start time in past

trans-unit.source: Run once immediately
trans-unit.target: Run once immediately

trans-unit.source: Calculate first future execution time after start time, and run at that time
trans-unit.target: Calculate first future execution time after start time, and run at that time

trans-unit.source: Run subsequent executions based oncalculating from last execution time
trans-unit.target: Run subsequent executions based oncalculating from last execution time

trans-unit.source: See example after this table for a further explanation
trans-unit.target: See example after this table for a further explanation

trans-unit.source: Job starts _no sooner than_ the specified start time.
trans-unit.target: Job starts _no sooner than_ the specified start time.

trans-unit.source: The first occurrence is based on the schedule calculated from the start time
trans-unit.target: The first occurrence is based on the schedule calculated from the start time

trans-unit.source: Run subsequent executions based on recurrence schedule
trans-unit.target: Run subsequent executions based on recurrence schedule

trans-unit.source: Start time in future or at present
trans-unit.target: Start time in future or at present

trans-unit.source: Run once at specified start time
trans-unit.target: Run once at specified start time

trans-unit.source: Run once at specified start time
trans-unit.target: Run once at specified start time

trans-unit.source: Run subsequent executions based on calculating from last execution time
trans-unit.target: Run subsequent executions based on calculating from last execution time

trans-unit.source: Job starts _no sooner than_ the specified start time.
trans-unit.target: Job starts _no sooner than_ the specified start time.

trans-unit.source: The first occurrence is based on the schedule calculated from the start time
trans-unit.target: The first occurrence is based on the schedule calculated from the start time

trans-unit.source: Run subsequent executions based on recurrence schedule
trans-unit.target: Run subsequent executions based on recurrence schedule

trans-unit.source: Let's see an example of what happens where _startTime_ is in the past, with _recurrence_ but no _schedule_.
trans-unit.target: Let's see an example of what happens where _startTime_ is in the past, with _recurrence_ but no _schedule_.

trans-unit.source: Assume that the current time is 2015-04-08 13:00, _startTime_ is 2015-04-07 14:00, and _recurrence_ is every 2 days (defined with _frequency_: day and _interval_: 2.) Note that the _startTime_ is in the past, and occurs before the current time
trans-unit.target: Assume that the current time is 2015-04-08 13:00, _startTime_ is 2015-04-07 14:00, and _recurrence_ is every 2 days (defined with _frequency_: day and _interval_: 2.) Note that the _startTime_ is in the past, and occurs before the current time

trans-unit.source: Under these conditions, the _first execution_ will be 2015-04-09 at 14:00\.
trans-unit.target: Under these conditions, the _first execution_ will be 2015-04-09 at 14:00\.

trans-unit.source: The Scheduler engine calculates execution occurrences from the start time.
trans-unit.target: The Scheduler engine calculates execution occurrences from the start time.

trans-unit.source: Any instances in the past are discarded.
trans-unit.target: Any instances in the past are discarded.

trans-unit.source: The engine uses the next instance that occurs in the future.
trans-unit.target: The engine uses the next instance that occurs in the future.

trans-unit.source: So in this case, _startTime_ is 2015-04-07 at 2:00pm, so the next instance is 2 days from that time, which is 2015-04-09 at 2:00pm.
trans-unit.target: So in this case, _startTime_ is 2015-04-07 at 2:00pm, so the next instance is 2 days from that time, which is 2015-04-09 at 2:00pm.

trans-unit.source: Note that the first execution would be the same even if the startTime 2015-04-05 14:00 or 2015-04-01 14:00\.
trans-unit.target: Note that the first execution would be the same even if the startTime 2015-04-05 14:00 or 2015-04-01 14:00\.

trans-unit.source: After the first execution, subsequent executions are calculated using the scheduled – so they'd be at 2015-04-11 at 2:00pm, then 2015-04-13 at 2:00pm, then 2015-04-15 at 2:00pm, etc.
trans-unit.target: After the first execution, subsequent executions are calculated using the scheduled – so they'd be at 2015-04-11 at 2:00pm, then 2015-04-13 at 2:00pm, then 2015-04-15 at 2:00pm, etc.

trans-unit.source: Finally, when a job has a schedule, if hours and/or minutes aren’t set in the schedule, they default to the hours and/or minutes of the first execution, respectively.
trans-unit.target: Finally, when a job has a schedule, if hours and/or minutes aren’t set in the schedule, they default to the hours and/or minutes of the first execution, respectively.

trans-unit.source: Deep Dive: _schedule_
trans-unit.target: Deep Dive: _schedule_

trans-unit.source: On one hand, a _schedule_ can _limit_ the number of job executions.
trans-unit.target: On one hand, a _schedule_ can _limit_ the number of job executions.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a job with a "month" frequency has a _schedule_ that runs on only day 31, the job runs in only those months that have a 31<sup>st</sup> day.
trans-unit.target: For example, if a job with a "month" frequency has a _schedule_ that runs on only day 31, the job runs in only those months that have a 31<sup>st</sup> day.

trans-unit.source: On the other hand, a _schedule_ can also _expand_ the number of job executions.
trans-unit.target: On the other hand, a _schedule_ can also _expand_ the number of job executions.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a job with a "month" frequency has a _schedule_ that runs on month days 1 and 2, the job runs on the 1<sup>st</sup> and 2<sup>nd</sup> days of the month instead of just once a month.
trans-unit.target: For example, if a job with a "month" frequency has a _schedule_ that runs on month days 1 and 2, the job runs on the 1<sup>st</sup> and 2<sup>nd</sup> days of the month instead of just once a month.

trans-unit.source: If multiple schedule elements are specified, the order of evaluation is from the largest to smallest – week number, month day, week day, hour, and minute.
trans-unit.target: If multiple schedule elements are specified, the order of evaluation is from the largest to smallest – week number, month day, week day, hour, and minute.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes _schedule_ elements in detail.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes _schedule_ elements in detail.

trans-unit.source: JSON name
trans-unit.target: JSON name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Valid Values
trans-unit.target: Valid Values

trans-unit.source: minutes
trans-unit.target: minutes

trans-unit.source: Minutes of the hour at which the job will run
trans-unit.target: Minutes of the hour at which the job will run

trans-unit.source: Integer, or
trans-unit.target: Integer, or

trans-unit.source: Array of integers
trans-unit.target: Array of integers

trans-unit.source: hours
trans-unit.target: hours

trans-unit.source: Hours of the day at which the job will run
trans-unit.target: Hours of the day at which the job will run

trans-unit.source: Integer, or
trans-unit.target: Integer, or

trans-unit.source: Array of integers
trans-unit.target: Array of integers

trans-unit.source: weekDays
trans-unit.target: weekDays

trans-unit.source: Days of the week the job will run.
trans-unit.target: Days of the week the job will run.

trans-unit.source: Can only be specified with a weekly frequency.
trans-unit.target: Can only be specified with a weekly frequency.

trans-unit.source: "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday", or "Sunday"
trans-unit.target: "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday", or "Sunday"

trans-unit.source: Array of any of the above values (max array size 7)
trans-unit.target: Array of any of the above values (max array size 7)

trans-unit.source: _Not_ case-sensitive
trans-unit.target: _Not_ case-sensitive

trans-unit.source: monthlyOccurrences
trans-unit.target: monthlyOccurrences

trans-unit.source: Determines which days of the month the job will run.
trans-unit.target: Determines which days of the month the job will run.

trans-unit.source: Can only be specified with a monthly frequency.
trans-unit.target: Can only be specified with a monthly frequency.

trans-unit.source: Array of monthlyOccurence objects:
trans-unit.target: Array of monthlyOccurence objects:

trans-unit.source: { "day": _day_,
trans-unit.target: { "day": _day_,

trans-unit.source: "occurrence": _occurence_
trans-unit.target: "occurrence": _occurence_

trans-unit.source: _day_ is the day of the week the job will run, e.g. {Sunday} is every Sunday of the month.
trans-unit.target: _day_ is the day of the week the job will run, e.g. {Sunday} is every Sunday of the month.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Occurrence is _occurrence_ of the day during the month, e.g. {Sunday, -1} is the last Sunday of the month.
trans-unit.target: Occurrence is _occurrence_ of the day during the month, e.g. {Sunday, -1} is the last Sunday of the month.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: monthDays
trans-unit.target: monthDays

trans-unit.source: Day of the month the job will run.
trans-unit.target: Day of the month the job will run.

trans-unit.source: Can only be specified with a monthly frequency.
trans-unit.target: Can only be specified with a monthly frequency.

trans-unit.source: Any value <= -1 and >= -31.
trans-unit.target: Any value <= -1 and >= -31.

trans-unit.source: Any value >= 1 and <= 31.
trans-unit.target: Any value >= 1 and <= 31.

trans-unit.source: An array of above values
trans-unit.target: An array of above values

trans-unit.source: Examples: Recurrence Schedules
trans-unit.target: Examples: Recurrence Schedules

trans-unit.source: The following are various examples of recurrence schedules – focusing on the schedule object and its sub-elements.
trans-unit.target: The following are various examples of recurrence schedules – focusing on the schedule object and its sub-elements.

trans-unit.source: The schedules below all assume that the _interval_ is set to 1\.
trans-unit.target: The schedules below all assume that the _interval_ is set to 1\.

trans-unit.source: Also, one must assume the right frequency in accordance to what is in the _schedule_ – e.g., one can't use frequency "day" and have a "monthDays" modification in the schedule.
trans-unit.target: Also, one must assume the right frequency in accordance to what is in the _schedule_ – e.g., one can't use frequency "day" and have a "monthDays" modification in the schedule.

trans-unit.source: Such restrictions are described above.
trans-unit.target: Such restrictions are described above.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Run at 5AM Every Day.
trans-unit.target: Run at 5AM Every Day.

trans-unit.source: Azure Scheduler matches up each value in "hours" with each value in "minutes", one by one, to create a list of all the times at which the job is to be run.
trans-unit.target: Azure Scheduler matches up each value in "hours" with each value in "minutes", one by one, to create a list of all the times at which the job is to be run.

trans-unit.source: Run at 5:15AM Every Day
trans-unit.target: Run at 5:15AM Every Day

trans-unit.source: Run at 5:15 AM and 5:15 PM Every Day
trans-unit.target: Run at 5:15 AM and 5:15 PM Every Day

trans-unit.source: Run at 5:15AM, 5:45AM, 5:15PM, and 5:45PM Every Day
trans-unit.target: Run at 5:15AM, 5:45AM, 5:15PM, and 5:45PM Every Day

trans-unit.source: Run Every 15 Minutes
trans-unit.target: Run Every 15 Minutes

trans-unit.source: Run Every Hour.
trans-unit.target: Run Every Hour.

trans-unit.source: This job runs every hour.
trans-unit.target: This job runs every hour.

trans-unit.source: The minute is controlled by the _startTime_, if one is specified, or if none is specified, by the creation time.
trans-unit.target: The minute is controlled by the _startTime_, if one is specified, or if none is specified, by the creation time.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the start time or creation time (whichever applies) is 12:25 PM, the job will be run at 00:25, 01:25, 02:25, …, 23:25.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the start time or creation time (whichever applies) is 12:25 PM, the job will be run at 00:25, 01:25, 02:25, …, 23:25.

trans-unit.source: The schedule is equivalent to having a job with _frequency_ of "hour", an _interval_ of 1, and no _schedule_.
trans-unit.target: The schedule is equivalent to having a job with _frequency_ of "hour", an _interval_ of 1, and no _schedule_.

trans-unit.source: The difference is that this schedule could be used with different _frequency_ and _interval_ to create other jobs too.
trans-unit.target: The difference is that this schedule could be used with different _frequency_ and _interval_ to create other jobs too.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the _frequency_ were "month", the schedule would run only once a month instead of every day if _frequency_ were "day"
trans-unit.target: For example, if the _frequency_ were "month", the schedule would run only once a month instead of every day if _frequency_ were "day"

trans-unit.source: Run Every Hour on the Hour.
trans-unit.target: Run Every Hour on the Hour.

trans-unit.source: This job also runs every hour, but on the hour (e.g. 12AM, 1AM, 2AM, etc.) This is equivalent to a job with frequency of "hour", a startTime with zero minutes, and no schedule if the frequency were "day", but if the frequency were "week" or "month," the schedule would execute only one day a week or one day a month, respectively.
trans-unit.target: This job also runs every hour, but on the hour (e.g. 12AM, 1AM, 2AM, etc.) This is equivalent to a job with frequency of "hour", a startTime with zero minutes, and no schedule if the frequency were "day", but if the frequency were "week" or "month," the schedule would execute only one day a week or one day a month, respectively.

trans-unit.source: Run at 15 Minutes Past Hour Every Hour.
trans-unit.target: Run at 15 Minutes Past Hour Every Hour.

trans-unit.source: Runs every hour, starting at 00:15AM, 1:15AM, 2:15AM, etc. and ending at 10:15PM and 11:15PM.
trans-unit.target: Runs every hour, starting at 00:15AM, 1:15AM, 2:15AM, etc. and ending at 10:15PM and 11:15PM.

trans-unit.source: Run at 5PM on Saturdays Every Week
trans-unit.target: Run at 5PM on Saturdays Every Week

trans-unit.source: Run at 5PM on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday Every Week
trans-unit.target: Run at 5PM on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday Every Week

trans-unit.source: Run at 5:15PM and 5:45PM on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday Every Week
trans-unit.target: Run at 5:15PM and 5:45PM on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday Every Week

trans-unit.source: Run at 5AM and 5PM on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday Every Week
trans-unit.target: Run at 5AM and 5PM on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday Every Week

trans-unit.source: Run at 5:15AM, 5:45AM, 5:15PM, and 5:45PM on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday Every Week
trans-unit.target: Run at 5:15AM, 5:45AM, 5:15PM, and 5:45PM on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday Every Week

trans-unit.source: Run Every 15 Minutes on Weekdays
trans-unit.target: Run Every 15 Minutes on Weekdays

trans-unit.source: Run Every 15 Minutes on Weekdays between 9AM and 4:45PM
trans-unit.target: Run Every 15 Minutes on Weekdays between 9AM and 4:45PM

trans-unit.source: Run on Sundays at Start Time
trans-unit.target: Run on Sundays at Start Time

trans-unit.source: Run on Tuesdays and Thursdays at Start Time
trans-unit.target: Run on Tuesdays and Thursdays at Start Time

trans-unit.source: Run at 6AM on the 28th Day of Every Month (assuming frequency of month)
trans-unit.target: Run at 6AM on the 28th Day of Every Month (assuming frequency of month)

trans-unit.source: Run at 6AM on the Last Day of the Month.
trans-unit.target: Run at 6AM on the Last Day of the Month.

trans-unit.source: If you'd like to run a job on the last day of a month, use -1 instead of day 28, 29, 30, or 31.
trans-unit.target: If you'd like to run a job on the last day of a month, use -1 instead of day 28, 29, 30, or 31.

trans-unit.source: Run at 6AM on the First and Last Day of Every Month
trans-unit.target: Run at 6AM on the First and Last Day of Every Month

trans-unit.source: Run on the First and Last Day of Every Month at Start Time
trans-unit.target: Run on the First and Last Day of Every Month at Start Time

trans-unit.source: Run on the First and Fourteenth Day of Every Month at Start Time
trans-unit.target: Run on the First and Fourteenth Day of Every Month at Start Time

trans-unit.source: Run on the Second Day of the Month at Start Time
trans-unit.target: Run on the Second Day of the Month at Start Time

trans-unit.source: Run on First Friday of Every Month at 5AM
trans-unit.target: Run on First Friday of Every Month at 5AM

trans-unit.source: : Run on First Friday of Every Month at Start Time
trans-unit.target: : Run on First Friday of Every Month at Start Time

trans-unit.source: Run on Third Friday from End of Month, Every Month, at Start Time
trans-unit.target: Run on Third Friday from End of Month, Every Month, at Start Time

trans-unit.source: Run on First and Last Friday of Every Month at 5:15AM
trans-unit.target: Run on First and Last Friday of Every Month at 5:15AM

trans-unit.source: Run on First and Last Friday of Every Month at Start Time
trans-unit.target: Run on First and Last Friday of Every Month at Start Time

trans-unit.source: Run on Fifth Friday of Every Month at Start Time.
trans-unit.target: Run on Fifth Friday of Every Month at Start Time.

trans-unit.source: If there is no fifth Friday in a month, this does not run, since it's scheduled to run on only fifth Fridays.
trans-unit.target: If there is no fifth Friday in a month, this does not run, since it's scheduled to run on only fifth Fridays.

trans-unit.source: You may consider using -1 instead of 5 for the occurrence if you want to run the job on the last occurring Friday of the month.
trans-unit.target: You may consider using -1 instead of 5 for the occurrence if you want to run the job on the last occurring Friday of the month.

trans-unit.source: Run Every 15 Minutes on Last Friday of the Month
trans-unit.target: Run Every 15 Minutes on Last Friday of the Month

trans-unit.source: Run at 5:15AM, 5:45AM, 5:15PM, and 5:45PM on the 3rd Wednesday of Every Month
trans-unit.target: Run at 5:15AM, 5:45AM, 5:15PM, and 5:45PM on the 3rd Wednesday of Every Month
